intro: Lithocardium guayaquilense, commonly known as the Guayaquil lithocardium, is a flowering plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its succulent stems and spiny structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, blooming during the dry season. Lithocardium guayaquilense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
